@designbytbc #Repost @people_who_rise For Thierry Courtois, a Formula E Fan  working his way up to the Mahindra Racing team was a dream come true. It all started when he entered the livery design competition for the M3Electro  @mahindraracings Contender for Season 3, and was selected as one of the finalists. The racing team soon realised Thierrys infectious passion for design and motorsport, and got him on board as the Creative Designer for the team.Thierry has come a long way, from designing race posters, marketing collaterals to now being the go-to-guy for all things design on the team. His latest feat is the livery of the M5Electro  Mahindra Racings Gen2 Formula E race car. For him, this has been an experience like none other  challenging, yet exciting nonetheless. Not only did it give him the chance to try his hands at 3D design software (and master it), but it also inspired him to achieve more than what he thought he could.Thierry strongly believes that great design should be more than just visually appealing  it should be functional, innovative and evoke strong emotions from the viewer. Its no wonder that he prototyped and analysed endlessly, making more than 25 samples and 7 livery designs to strike the perfect balance between function and form for the M5Electro. And ultimately, after several iterations, seeing the final design come to life on the race track was nothing short of amazing. More so when the race car is on the podium  its a double celebration for Thierry  the creative spark for Mahindra Racing.....#passioneering #FUTURise #PeopleWhoRise #MahindraRise #Mahindra #RiseStory #motivation #inspiration #SuccessStory #Technology #Innovation #Racing #Motorsport #MahindraRacing #Art #ArtOfTheDay #Illustration #FormulaE #MotorsportLife #MahindraRacing #M5Electro #Designer

#Repost @people_who_rise After years of serving as a Lance Corporal in the HM Armed Forces, Ash Walker decided to live the civilian way of life and joined the team at @mahindraracing. But just as he began to get a taste his new lifestyle, he realised the transition was not going to be an easy one  at least in the beginning. As Ash settled into the job, he observed that most of the army values he had learnt over the years could be applied to his current work. For starters, the army veteran believes in self-discipline, punctuality and team work. After all, he is the Quartermaster at Mahindra Racing and his every move is responsible for the teams success. Although, it was initially an uphill climb for Ash. With no background in engineering, every day was a challenge. Instead of the army life he was originally used to, he now had to get familiar with engineering jargons. But just like most of Mahindra Racings achievements, he too caught up to speed with it. More often than not, he always had someone to fall back upon in case of difficulty and within no time, he was well aware of the drill. Today, he is proud to be a part of the team that put together the M5Electro  their latest Generation 2 Formula E car. Yet, Ash feels theres still a lot for him to learn. So while he has his heart set on the win for Mahindra Racing with their new Formula E car in the new season, he is also looking forward to graduating with a Motorsport Engineer Degree. #Repost @people_who_rise Years ago, Dilbagh Gill met with an accident while racing on his motorcycle. But within no time, he had his head back in the game. For him, motorsport has always been a thing of passion. In fact, it was when @gill.dilbagh was in college that he kick-started his career by repairing and racing old motorcycles. Today, the CEO and Team Principal of @mahindraracing orchestrates the only Indian Formula E team thats part of an all-electric international sport.When Dilbagh started off, both Mahindra and him were new to the motorsport.
